title: Blog; Political Insider; Immigration as an '08 issue: Tancredo for president?
body:
Thursday, November 30, 2006, 02:20 PM

Just chatted an hour or so ago with Steve Scheffler, president of the Iowa Christian Alliance. He said he's come 
across feelers that U.S. Rep. Tom Tancredo, the Colorado Republican, has put out for a presidential run.

A Tancredo candidacy could test the continued strength of immigration as a key to the Republican base. The 
Colorado congressman has made a cottage industry of criticizing U.S. immigration policy. Most recently, he ticked 
off Florida Gov. Jeb Bush, the president's brother, for referring to Miami as "a Third World country."
